name: Pull-ups
how_to_perform:
1. Find a sturdy bar that is at least waist-level high, with a comfortable grip distance between the bar and you.
2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine and maintaining a tight body position throughout the exercise.

3. Grip the bar with an overhand grip (palms facing away from your body), ensuring that your hands are shoulder-width apart on the bar.
4. Lift your feet off the ground and, with your arms straight, hoist yourself up by pulling down on the bar with your hands.
5. Continue to pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar level or as high as you can reach, keeping your elbows close to your body and focusing on contracting your back muscles.
6. Pause briefly at the top of the movement.

7. To begin dismounting from the bar, slowly lower yourself down by releasing the grip with your hands.
8. Land quietly in a neutral position, ensuring that you maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Pull-ups are an upper body exercise primarily targeting the latissimus dorsi (back) and other surrounding muscle groups when performed properly.
